Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially grey-black in section, the interior is lightly covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and very faint traces of at least seven lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394453) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394453)
